other_tests.findings: Initial platelet count was 20,000 giga/L at the time of first delivery and 46,000 giga/L during consultation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Platelet count changes: 36,000 giga/L on the delivery day, decreased to 30,000 giga/L after a transfusion, then improved to 10,000 giga/L post-operation, and gradually increased to 53,000 giga/L by discharge on postoperative day four.

other_tests.procedure_name: vWF:RCo Activity and Factor VIII Concentration Tests
other_tests.findings: At time of hospital discharge, vWF:RCo activity was 454%, and factor VIII concentrations were 258%.
Revealed spinal epidural hematoma extending from T12 to L3 with maximum diameter between T12 and L1.
Catheter placement at T8â€“9 was successful; 4 ml of bupivacaine 0.25% plus hydromorphone was administered.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperative day 2 showed development of profound bilateral lower extremity weakness; symptoms resolved after removal of the catheter and discontinuation of the infusion.

other_tests.findings: First administration provided immediate pain relief in perineal area after the block.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Pain relief lasted approximately 5 months before returning to 80% of the pretreatment level, followed by repeat blockade, which reestablished pain relief.
